longDef.en: something that is very important and must be dealt with before other things

examples.en: The management did not seem to consider office safety a priority.
examples.cn: 管理部门似乎并不认为应优先考虑办公室安全问题。

examples.en: My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.
examples.cn: 我首先要考虑的是找个地方住。

examples.en: You have to learn to get your priorities right/straight (= decide which are the most important jobs or problems and deal with them first).
examples.cn: 你必须学会先处理最重要的事。

examples.en: Repairing the plumbing is a priority task (= more important than other jobs).
Banks normally give priority to large businesses when deciding on loans (= they deal with them first because they consider them most important).
examples.cn: 银行在发放贷款时通常优先考虑大企业。

examples.en: Official business requirements obviously take/have priority over personal requests (= official business matters will be dealt with first).
examples.cn: 公事显然应放在私事之上。
